column4: Ok, so I'm back again, Inside a Live environment whereas there is no option on a 12.04 disc to run a repair. Perhaps someone can help me with repairing my grub on an efi install
!ask AnthonyKK
Anybody have any advice on how to repair a botched grub install from inside a live environment?
Grub still gives me a pain in the !!!
I've already sent you a link to how to fix it
I don't think there was enough room on the live-cd to include it, but the instructions are fairly straight forward.
if you use firefox from the live-cd, you can even copy-paste a fair bit of it
did you set up nomodeset on the installed grub as well?
That's the only way i can get a semi workable installation going. "Failed to load device in PCI 1.0.0" or something to that nature
what video card is it?
Geforce GTX 550ti
http://askubuntu.com/questions/127305/how-to-install-ubuntu-12-04-on-a-computer-with-a-nvidia-geforce-gtx-550-ti has a few tips that may help
also, does switching to a TTY interface work?
yes
have you tried installing the binary drivers?
when did it download and install it?
ubuntu will not automatically install the binary video card drivers, that must be done manually (either via cli or the "restricted drivers" tool in the GUI)
I understand your concern but at this point I'm about ready to start sacraficing gnomes to please whatever delights in such misery :D
go with the wiki page, that is the *official* installation method. I've seen way too many people hose their systems by following how-to's on peoples' blogs
I can't do half of what the wiki is telling me because they require X to actually be running.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia#Installation_without_X_.2BAC8_from_the_console
or go with Chuck_Norris's one (simpler)
